name: Html.Animation

types.name: Action
types.comment:
Actions to be run on an animation. 
You won't be constructing using this type directly, though it may show up in your type signatures.

To start animations you'll be using the `animate`, `queue`, and `stagger` functions

values.name: add
values.comment: Animate a StyleProperty by adding to its existing value

values.name: andThen
values.comment:
Append another keyframe.  This is used for multistage animations.  For example, to cycle through colors, we'd use the following:

      UI.animate 
              |> UI.props 
                  [ UI.BackgroundColor 
                        UI.toRGBA 100 100 100 1.0  
                  ] 
          |> UI.andThen -- create a new keyframe
              |> UI.duration (1*second)
              |> UI.props 
                  [ UI.BackgroundColor 
                        UI.toRGBA 178 201 14 1.0 
                  ] 
          |> UI.andThen 
              |> UI.props 
                  [ UI.BackgroundColor 
                        UI.toRGBA 58 40 69 1.0 
                  ] 
          |> UI.on model.style

values.name: animate
values.comment:
Begin describing an animation.  This animation will cleanly interrupt any animation that is currently running.

      UI.animate 
         |> UI.duration (0.4*second)
         |> UI.props 
             [ UI.Left UI.Px (UI.to 0) 
             , UI.Opacity (UI.to 1)
             ] 
         |> UI.on model.style

values.name: delay
values.comment: Optionally specify a delay.  The default is 0.

values.name: duration
values.comment: Optionally specify a duration.  The default is 400ms.

values.name: easing
values.comment:
Opitionally specify an easing function.  It is expected that values should match up at the beginning and end.  So, f 0 == 0 and f 1 == 1.  The default easing is sinusoidal
in-out.

values.name: forwardTo
values.comment:
Can be used in place of `on`.  Instead of applying an update directly to a Animation model,
you can forward the update to a specific element in a list that has a Animation model.

To use this function, you'll need to supply a getter and a setter function for getting and setting the style model.

So, for a model like the following

    type alias Model = { widgets : List Widget }

    type alias Widget = 
              { style : UI.Animation
              }
You'd probably want to create a specialized version of `forwardTo`.

    forwardToWidget = UI.forwardTo 
                        .style -- widget style getter
                        (\w style -> { w | style = style }) -- widget style setter

Which you can then use to apply an animation to a widget in a list.

    (widgets, fx) = 
            UI.animate
                |> UI.duration (5*second)
                |> UI.props 
                    [ UI.Opacity (UI.to 0)  
                    ] 
                |> forwardToWidget i model.widgets
                -- Where i is the index of the widget to update.
values.type: (Int -> Html.Animation.Action -> b) -> (a -> Html.Animation.Animation) -> (a -> Html.Animation.Animation -> a) -> Int -> List a -> Html.Animation.Action -> ( List a, Effects.Effects b )

values.name: forwardToAll
values.comment: Same as `forwardTo`, except it applies an update to every member of the list.
values.type: (Int -> Html.Animation.Action -> b) -> (a -> Html.Animation.Animation) -> (a -> Html.Animation.Animation -> a) -> List a -> Html.Animation.Action -> ( List a, Effects.Effects b )

values.name: fromColor
values.comment: Specify an initial Color-based property using a Color from the elm core Color module.
values.type: Color.Color -> (Html.Animation.Static -> Html.Animation.Static -> Html.Animation.Static -> Html.Animation.Static -> Html.Animation.StyleProperty Html.Animation.Static) -> Html.Animation.StyleProperty Html.Animation.Static

values.name: hsl
values.comment: Specify an initial Color-based property using hsl
values.type: Float -> Float -> Float -> (Html.Animation.Static -> Html.Animation.Static -> Html.Animation.Static -> Html.Animation.Static -> Html.Animation.StyleProperty Html.Animation.Static) -> Html.Animation.StyleProperty Html.Animation.Static

values.name: hsla
values.comment: Specify an initial Color-based property using hsla
values.type: Float -> Float -> Float -> Float -> (Html.Animation.Static -> Html.Animation.Static -> Html.Animation.Static -> Html.Animation.Static -> Html.Animation.StyleProperty Html.Animation.Static) -> Html.Animation.StyleProperty Html.Animation.Static

values.name: init
values.comment:
Create an initial style for your init model.

__Note__ All properties that you animate must be present in the init or else that property won't be animated.

values.name: minus
values.comment: Animate a StyleProperty by subtracting to its existing value

values.name: on
values.comment:
Apply an update to a Animation model.  This is used at the end of constructing an animation.

     UI.animate 
         |> UI.duration (0.4*second)
         |> UI.props 
             [ UI.Left UI.Px (UI.to 0) 
             , UI.Opacity (UI.to 1)
             ] 
         |> UI.on model.style

values.name: props
values.comment:
Specify the properties that should be animated

     UI.animate 
         |> UI.duration (0.4*second)
         |> UI.props 
             [ UI.Left UI.Px (UI.to 0) 
             , UI.Opacity (UI.to 1)
             ] 
         |> UI.on model.style

values.name: queue
values.comment:
The same as `animate` but instead of interrupting the current animation, this will queue up after the current animation is finished.

      UI.queue
         |> UI.duration (0.4*second)
         |> UI.props 
             [ UI.Left UI.Px (UI.to 0) 
             , UI.Opacity (UI.to 1)
             ] 
         |> UI.on model.style

values.name: render
values.comment:
Render into concrete css that can be directly applied to 'style' in elm-html

    div [ style (UI.render widget.style) ] [ ]

values.name: rgb
values.comment: Specify an initial Color-based property using rgb
values.type: Float -> Float -> Float -> (Html.Animation.Static -> Html.Animation.Static -> Html.Animation.Static -> Html.Animation.Static -> Html.Animation.StyleProperty Html.Animation.Static) -> Html.Animation.StyleProperty Html.Animation.Static

values.name: rgba
values.comment: Specify an initial Color-based property using rgba
values.type: Float -> Float -> Float -> Float -> (Html.Animation.Static -> Html.Animation.Static -> Html.Animation.Static -> Html.Animation.Static -> Html.Animation.StyleProperty Html.Animation.Static) -> Html.Animation.StyleProperty Html.Animation.Static

values.name: stagger
values.comment:
Can be used to stagger animations on a list of widgets.

     UI.stagger
        (\i -> 
           UI.animate
             |> UI.delay (i * 0.05 * second) -- The delay is staggered based on list index
             |> UI.duration (0.3 * second)
             |> UI.props 
                 [ UI.Left (UI.to 200) UI.Px
                 ] 
          |> UI.andThen
             |> UI.delay (2.0 * second)
             |> UI.duration (0.3 * second)
             |> UI.props 
                 [ UI.Left (UI.to -50) UI.Px
                 ] 
        )
        |> forwardToAllWidgets model.widgets

values.name: stay
values.comment: Keep an animation where it is!  This is useful for stacking transforms.

values.name: to
values.comment: Animate a StyleProperty to a value.

values.name: toColor
values.comment: Animate a color-based property, given a color from the Color elm module.

values.name: toHSL
values.comment: Animate a color-based style property to an hsl color. Note: this leaves the alpha channel where it is.
values.type: Float -> Float -> Float -> Html.Animation.ColorProperty -> Html.Animation.StyleProperty Html.Animation.Dynamic

values.name: toHSLA
values.comment: Animate a color-based style property to an hsla color.
values.type: Float -> Float -> Float -> Float -> Html.Animation.ColorProperty -> Html.Animation.StyleProperty Html.Animation.Dynamic

values.name: toRGB
values.comment:
Animate a color-based style property to an rgb color.  Note: this leaves the alpha channel where it is.

     UI.animate 
            |> UI.props 
                [ UI.BackgroundColor 
                      UI.toRGB 100 100 100  
                ] 
            |> UI.on model.style
values.type: Float -> Float -> Float -> Html.Animation.ColorProperty -> Html.Animation.StyleProperty Html.Animation.Dynamic

values.name: toRGBA
values.comment:
Animate a color-based style property to an rgba color.

       UI.animate 
            |> UI.props 
                [ UI.BackgroundColor 
                      UI.toRGBA 100 100 100 1.0  
                ] 
            |> UI.on model.style
values.type: Float -> Float -> Float -> Float -> Html.Animation.ColorProperty -> Html.Animation.StyleProperty Html.Animation.Dynamic

values.name: update
values.comment: Update an animation.  This will probably only show up once in your code.  See any of the examples at [https://github.com/mdgriffith/elm-html-animation](https://github.com/mdgriffith/elm-html-animation)
